title: Highlights from Pakistan's Pashto-language TV, press, websites 18 Dec 19
snippet:
THE FOLLOWING IS A BBCM SELECTION OF MAJOR NEWS ITEMS PUBLISHED IN PAKISTAN'S PASHTO-LANGUAGE TV, PRESS AND ONLINE MEDIA OUTLETS ON 18 December 2019.

Wahdat
body:
Pakistan wants peace in Afghanistan: PM Khan

Prime Minister (PM) Imran Khan has said that the United Nations and international community should take notice of the situation in Indian-administered Kashmir. He added that if the Kashmir issue was not addressed in proper way, it could lead into war between the two nuclear armed nations. He stated that Pakistan is hosting 3m Afghan refugees and the country wants peace and permanent solution to the Afghanistan issue. (front page, 250 word approx.)

Pakistan army condemns court's verdict on former president

The Inter Service Public Relations (ISPR - Pakistan's military media wing) has issued a statement in response to the special court's death sentence verdict awarded to the former president and the former army chief General (retired) Pervez Musharraf. The statements said that the decision has been received with lot of pain, anguish by the armed forces; Pervez Musharraf served the country for over 40 years, fought wars and can surely never be a traitor. (front page, 160s words appox.)

KP government to issue grant for hosting tourists

The tourism minister of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP), Atif Khan, has said that the locals in Swat, Chitral and Hazara districts would be paid one-million rupees (6,451 dollars) grant for hosting visitors in their homes, a total of 500m rupees (3.2 million dollars) of grant would be provided. He said the locals in tourist spots would also be trained. (front page, 100 words approx.)

[Wahdat gives good and equal coverage to both sides of the Durand Line (Pakistan-Afghan frontier), with a focus on Pashtun issues. The paper also publishes interviews with Afghan political leaders. It provides a balanced mix of anti-Taliban and pro-Taliban opinion.]

Khabroona

Musharraf disappointed over court decision

General (retired) Pervez Musharraf has shown disappointment over decision of the special court. Sources said that Musharraf would respond to the verdict after consultation with his legal team. Earlier in his video message, Musharraf had said that the courts did not hear him in the case. (front page, 180 words approx.)

KP government pays compensation for damaged houses

The KP government on behalf of the federal government has distributed 24.8bn rupees (approx. 158.7m dollars) to residents of tribal districts for their damaged houses. So far, the compensation for 73,728 damaged houses has been done. Government is paying 400,000 rupees (2580 dollars) for the demolished house, while, 160,000 (1032 dollars) for partially damaged house. (front page, 150 words approx.)

Pakistan paid back over nine-billion dollar loans

Minister of Economic Affairs Hammad Azhar has said that in last one year, the government borrowed loans worth 12.5bn to 13bn dollars, while on other end, the government paid back 9.1bn dollars of debts. He added that United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Qatar has paid 5.5bn dollars to State Bank of Pakistan. (back page, 140 words approx.)

[Khabroona is owned by the Peshawar-based Subh Group, which also publishes the Urdu daily Subh. It provides good coverage to both sides of the Durand Line (the Pakistan-Afghan frontier), with a focus on Pashtun issues. It provides a balanced mix of anti-Taliban and pro-Taliban opinion.]

Hewad

Explosion outside Peshawar High Court

Khyber Bar Council condemned the explosion outside the Peshawar High Court (PHC) and said that the blast was a warning for the lawyers. Bar Council President Latif Afiridi said that the situation of the country had deteriorated in the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) government. Advocate Ayaz said that lawyers' did a mistake by showing aggression in Lahore but the media should show both sides of the issue. (front page, 180 words approx.)

Government to complete CPEC projects soon

Special Assistant to Prime Minister for Information and Broadcasting, Dr Firdous Ashiq Awan, has said that government is committed to completed China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC - project under China's belt and road initiative) projects on priority basis. The projects will change fate of the country and it will bring the country on the track of development. She also appreciated media's role in countering the propaganda against CPEC. (back page, 150 words approx.)

Anti-polio campaign continues all over country

The Anti-polio campaign continued for second-day throughout the country. During the campaign, 50m children would be provided with the anti-polio vaccination and vitamin B. So far more than 100 cases surfaced in the country. Most of the cases were from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. During the campaign, 6.7m children in the KP would be vaccinated. (front page, 150 words approx.)

[Hewad is Pakistan's oldest Pashto newspaper, and gives equal coverage to both sides of the Durand Line (the Pakistan-Afghanistan frontier), with a focus on Pashtuns and religion.]

Tribal News Network

KP Government approves development schemes for tribal districts

Senior Minister Tourism, Sports , Youth , Culture & Archaeology of KP, Atif Khan, has said that the development of tribal districts is in top priorities of Prime Minister Imran Khan. He added that government has approved 9.5bn rupees (61.2m dollars) for tourism and 8.5bn rupees (54.8m dollars) for sports schemes. He said that government would soon initiate a 3bn rupees (19.3m dollars) project for engaging tribal youth in business. (front page, 180 words approx.)

Ex-President, military ruler sentenced to death

Former president and the army chief General (retired) Pervez Musharraf has been sentenced to death by a Special Court in the national capital Islamabad. The special court in its verdict has said that Musharraf violated constitution in November 2008. It was the first time that a person was sentenced to death for violating constitution. The case was heard by a three-member bench, headed by Waqar Ahmad Seth. (front page, 180 words approx.)

Democracy is best revenge, says opposition leader

Politicians' from various political parties have termed the decision of the Islamabad Special Court historic and has said that the decision would put an end to dictatorship in future. The Pakistan People's Party (PPP) chairman, Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, wrote on social media platform Twitter that "Democracy is the best revenge". The Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) leader Ahsan Iqbal said that the decision would end the culture of abrogating constitution. (front page, 200 words approx.)

[Tribal News Network (TNN) is a Peshawar-based online multimedia news agency. It provides news from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and the erstwhile tribal areas and focusses on their issues and problems. It was established in 2014 to serve radio audiences through partner FM radio stations and has now evolved into a news portal.]

Pashtun Gazette

US senator meets Afghan, Pakistani officials

The United States ruling party senator [member of upper chamber of the US Congress] Lindsay Graham along with other senators visited Pakistan and Afghanistan and met officials of both countries. Graham appreciated Pakistan for supporting Afghan peace process and said that he would play his role in Pakistan's economic development.

Senator also met the incumbent Afghanistan President Ashraf Ghani. Both leaders discussed the US forces withdrawal from Afghanistan. Senator said that the US President Donald Trump would announce withdrawal of forces in this week. (front page, 300 words approx.)

[Pashtun Gazette is a bilingual news portal in Pashto and Urdu. Reportage in the two languages differs due to the different target audiences. The Pashto section of the website is mostly about Pakistan's erstwhile tribal areas, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Afghanistan, while the Urdu section is about mainstream Pakistani issues.]

Date Line (Prime Time Talk Show on AVT Khyber News at 17:00 gmt)

Debate on former military ruler death sentence

Anchor Hassan Khan said that the last two days were historic in history of the Pakistan. He said the first day was about the Supreme Court's decision on the extension of Chief of Army Staff (COAS) General Qamar Javed Bajwa's service and that the parliament would decide on retirement, induction of the government servants. He said the second was on the special court's verdict, which sentenced former president and the former army chief General (retired) Pervez Musharraf to death on violation of constitution. Political parties have applauded the decision of court.

The Jamaat-i-Islami (JI) leader Abdul Akbar Chitrali said that the decisions showed that judiciary was now independent and said the violation of the constitution for self-interest was high treason. The decision would strengthen democracy. He said the sentence was awarded to a dictator and not to the armed forces. He said that Musharraf had betrayed the country and had sold people to the US.

The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) leader Bashir Khan said that the statements of politicians split the country into two, not the armed forces. He said that there was contradiction in justice system of the country, as people who looted the country were sent abroad on bail. He said Musharraf's abet should also be trailed.

Defence analyst Syed Nazir said that the decision was first of its kind in the country. He said the army is a professional institution and it would not be affected by an individual. He added that Pakistan should be kept on top, followed by the institution and their officials. He said history of the judiciary was not very bright.

[AVT Khyber News is Pakistan's first Pashto-language satellite news channel and was launched in 2007. The Islamabad-based channel is owned by the AVT group, which first launched AVT Khyber (an entertainment channel) in 2004. AVT says it is "the voice of Pashtuns around the world". It has a network of reporters in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province and in Afghanistan.]

Mashriq Leads (Prime Time Talk Show on Mashriq TV at 14:00 gmt)

Discussion on challenges faced by youth

Anchor Salman Ali Shah has said that youth were faced with number of challenges and discussed how they could handle it.

Motivational speaker Wajahat Ali Shah has said that the youth lacked guidance. He added that parents, teachers and community have a key role in upbringing of a child. He said youth should not misuse technology rather they could gain a lot from the better use of technology. He said the education should be imparted in mother tongue and change in curriculum was required.

Discussion on seasonal diseases in cold weather

Anchor Shah said that with change in weather, the numbers of seasonal diseases have increased. He stated that in November, 24,000 people visited Lady Reading hospital for seasonal diseases.

Dr Faisal Barakzai has said that dust and smoke from wood fire affected the respiratory system. He added people took medicines without doctor's prescription. He said in case of the infection, the doctors should be consulted by the patients.

Discussion on petition against lawyers' protests

A lawyer in Peshawar has submitted a writ petition against lawyers' protests in court, which adds miseries to petitioners in getting justice.

Advocate Ali Azeem said that justice is a constitutional right of a citizen and in accessing justice, there was no limitation. He said protests are in violation of the set rules and petitioners should not be barred from getting justice. He said that for the grievances, there should be token strikes.

[Mashriq TV is a Pashto-language channel launched in August 2016 and is a partner station of the BBC. It is owned by the Mashriq group of newspapers which also publishes English-language daily The Statement. The channel is observed to carry balanced reporting with no overt leanings towards any political party or group.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Pashto 1030 gmt 18 Dec 19
